explanation: Agent A is correct. In MHD_create_response_from_buffer_copy the code does memcpy(mhd_copy, buffer, size) after only checking buffer != NULL and size != 0. There is no check that the object pointed to by buffer actually contains at least size bytes, so a caller supplying a smaller object with a larger size will cause memcpy to read beyond the source bounds (undefined behaviour). Rule 21.17 forbids uses of memcpy (and other <string.h> functions) that can access beyond the referenced objects; the implementation as shown can do so, therefore it violates the rule unless an external, enforced precondition (documented and guaranteed at every call site) is relied upon.
